attributes.action: No Council in the Uk can set council tax rise higher than the rate of inflation.
attributes.background:
The average working class person only had a pay rise of 2.1% last year and cannot afford a yearly council tax rise 5%.
Councils should be more accountable for the way the spend, save and invest taxpayers money. They should look at the Thurrock council business model, it is almost self sufficient.

rejection.details:
Local councils are responsible for deciding the rate of council tax in their area. However, there is a legal cap on how much they can increase council tax without asking local people to vote on it in a referendum.

The Government has announced that this cap will be increased for 2018-19. You can find out more about this here:

http://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/SN05682

You could start a new petition calling for Parliament to change the law, so that local councils can't increase council tax by more than inflation.
